message.entry: Wrong number of input variables for DECODE.
The codeword length, N must be a positive integer greater than 0.
The message length, K must be a positive integer greater than 0.
The codeword length, N must be greater than the message length, K.
CODE for {0} code in decimal format must be a vector.
CODE must contain only positive integers smaller than 2^N.
CODE must contain only binary numbers.
The input CODE does not have the same format as the output of ENCODE. Check your computation procedures for possible errors.
CODE must be either a vector or a matrix with N columns.
The specified codeword length and message length are not valid.
The generator matrix is a required input argument for linear block decoding.
The generator matrix must be a K-by-N matrix.
The generator matrix must be in the standard form.
